comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
VIR_SECRET_USAGE_TYPE_ISCSI shouldn't be an issue since that was added to fakelibvirt recently:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/135854/
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
And VIR_CONNECT_LIST_DOMAINS_ACTIVE is in fakelibvirt as of this change last year:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/105121/

So the problem is really just that the tests pick up older versions of libvirt if they are installed and that replaces the usage of fakelibvirt altogether and if the version is old it blows up with the missing attributes.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
According to the distro support matrix:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix

We do support at least libvirt 0.9.8 on Ubuntu Precise 12.04 LTS and VIR_SECRET_USAGE_TYPE_ISCSI isn't defined in that version:

http://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=blob;f=include/libvirt/libvirt.h.in;h=2480adde42eab0fca6049202a38d335fade91734;hb=7c6b0653f347129857355738c0b7addd3ffc9242
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

commit 197e78650d708c116f3924771d047efa2ea0b583
Author: Rick Harris <email address hidden>
Date:   Thu Jan 29 14:40:15 2015 -0600

    libvirt: stub VIR_CONNECT_LIST_DOMAINS_ACTIVE for older libvirts
    
    Depending on the version of libvirt, `VIR_CONNECT_LIST_DOMAINS_ACTIVE`
    may not exist, so we need to stub out the attribute if it doesn't
    exist using the create=True kwarg in mock.
    
    This is added for test_list_instance_domains_fallback and we also
    remove the skip in test_list_instance_domains_fast to use the stub.
    
    Partial-Bug: #1422385
    
    Co-authored-by: Matt Riedemann <email address hidden>
    
    Change-Id: Id68801909a5561c2740e12de3238319fc4ea6338
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

commit 3f12978e6f2bebc2ac1b9c2e60cc283c71b260ac
Author: Matt Riedemann <email address hidden>
Date:   Mon Feb 16 08:48:17 2015 -0800

    libvirt: stub out VIR_SECRET_USAGE_TYPE_ISCSI for older libvirt
    
    The LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix says we support at least 0.9.8 on Ubuntu
    Precise 12.04 LTS and on that version the VIR_SECRET_USAGE_TYPE_ISCSI
    constant is not defined in libvirt.h.in so we need to mock it out in the
    tests that are using it until we've completely removed any chance of
    using a native libvirt and rely solely on fakelibvirt for stubbing out
    these values in unit tests.
    
    Closes-Bug: #1422385
    
    Change-Id: Ifb519caf7456cfc8beabdd48df8a86c78150b3db
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 5e23db46fd64e675ee8ceefdfc8cf0771ffed1cb
Author: Matt Riedemann <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Feb 17 13:48:22 2015 -0800

    libvirt: add TODOs for removing libvirt attribute stubs
    
    This goes through and adds TODOs to several stubs set in libvirt tests
    where fakelibvirt isn't used if a real libvirt is in the environment,
    but if the version of libvirt is old enough that it doesn't have the
    attributes, the tests fail with AttributeError. These are markers to
    cleanup once we've removed the ability to test against a real libvirt in
    the *unit* tests and rely on fakelibvirt only.
    
    Note that there are a couple of tests were attributes are explicitly set
    to test negative cases, e.g. setting VIR_DOMAIN_XML_MIGRATABLE to None
    for workaround flows in the driver code with older libvirts during
    migrations.
    
    This also adds the constants VIR_DOMAIN_XML_UPDATE_CPU and
    VIR_DOMAIN_XML_MIGRATABLE to fakelibvirt to prepare for an eventual
    cutover to fakelibvirt only tests.
    
    Related-Bug: #1422385
    
    Change-Id: Ib8098131b564934c0e96b4dda71c6810054f3d73
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

commit e12f17460c85e83fa98238d47789295668b2e22a
Author: Matt Riedemann <email address hidden>
Date:   Mon Mar 2 09:15:13 2015 -0800

    libvirt: remove libvirt import from tests so we only use fakelibvirt
    
    Commit 50861d3221f625a5cc589d903054bb2c440b4026 removed libvirt-python
    from test-requirements.txt and there have been several bug fixes in the
    libvirt tests for stubbing out attributes in the libvirt module used at
    test execution time to account for older versions of real libvirt
    imported.
    
    This removes the real libvirt imports so we solely test with fakelibvirt
    to avoid gaps in version testing.
    
    Related-Bug: #1422385
    
    Change-Id: I2b3bae594e2a99fb07d90ea5ac1b63172927162a
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
